content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Dad, are you thinking what I'm thinking?

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: That the car needs to be power washed?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Oh wait, I think a tooth brush is better.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Ummm sounds like something needs do be addressed.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Am I glad to see you! That's a famous word they used in the 1960s.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Watching videos of Elliott and Malia as newborns] Now, I'm a teenager. I can't believe it!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Oh, sorry! I wiped my nose on my napkin. I meant to do it on my sleeve.

content.speaker: Brian and Madiken
content.text: [burst out laughing with horrified looks on their faces]

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I mean I don't know where I meant to wipe it.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Stop being Malia's parent

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I'm not being her parent. I'm being an assistant.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Malia, what are Grandma and Grandpa going to think of you?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: SO ANNOYING

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [in his tour guide voice] Off to your right, you will see a little clearing

content.speaker: Malia
content.text: [spilled her milk at lunch] Oh mann!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Do you want to say life failure?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Brian setting up the Christmas tree and it was taking a while] Hey Mom! I think you should go get your agenda to see how many days this is going to take Dad!

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: I am not an expert in building destruction.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Oh, so let's watch a video of that today.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [putting Elliott to bed] Tomorrow is a school morning, okay?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Okay, I'm going to sleep in.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [after eating nachos for dinner]: I assume by my tummy that I ate too much.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [It's been raining all night now] Isn't it so pleasant when you can hear the rain?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Yes, I like it too.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Malia makes a sound while slowly waking from her nap upstairs] That sound isn't so pleasant

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Malia, can you say I'm all tuckered out?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: I wonder how much data there is in cough drops

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Data? On cough drops?! That doesn't make sense. Data is on computers.

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: Did Everleigh tell you what she's going to dress up as for Halloween?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Probably her pizza costume from last year.

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: Did she say that or you're just guessing?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: She probably said that and I'm guessing.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I'm probably guessing [It turns out Everleigh did tell him she was probably going to dress up as a pizza]

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Yelling from the other room while cleaning up] Malia is dumping out magnets on the floor!! Can a parent do their job?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Lying down in the bath with his ears under the water] Mommy!! Can hear me under the water?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Yes, your mouth is above the water.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Oh, yeah. That's right.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I gave Malia a list of stuff to do and she did it! All of it! And she even put my diaper in the trash can. Every single chore!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I can't control my dreams. Please, person in Heaven, can you please put a lock on my dreams.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: You are awake. You aren't dreaming, you are thinking.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: You can still dream when you are awake.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Elliott yelling to Brian from another room as Brian sits down for breakfast] Wait for me, son!

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [Elliott likes to play you don't know me at the dinner table. It consists of us getting to know his fictitious character by engaging him in many questions. Tonight, he was a 100-year-old and his birthday was yesterday] Madiken: What did you do for your birthday?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: 100 things, but I can't remember them.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: You're taking a long time to do nothing.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: You can't take a long time to do nothing.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: If you're taking a long time, you must be doing something.

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: [Elliott and I were talking about his upcoming triathlon and I was asking him lots of questions about it] What is your favorite sport (i.e., triathlon event)

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Hmm, I like basketball.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Windows are open and we are eating breakfast] What a pleasant sound. A rosemary bird flapping it's wings by the window.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Elliott, that was a U-Haul truck

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: My favorite thing about participating in a triathlon is chocolate milk at the end and winning!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [regarding his congestion] It feels like it's plugged, but when I put my finger up my nose it's not

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Shall we call and say hi to the Caldwells?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Well the Caldwells aren't feeling well today

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: How do you know that?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Well I know that for a fact

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I need the person with the shortest hair to come into the bathroom [referring to Madiken's recent haircut]

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Ok, Daddy's coming.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Wait. No! Ah, the person who is the cutest.

content.speaker: Everleigh
content.text: Elliott, want to tell me a joke?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Everleigh
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Elliott and Everleigh
content.text: [at the same time] Knock knock!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [eating his Italian sausage for dinner] I'm just eating my Italian restroom food.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Do you mean restaurant?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [looking through our kitchen drawers] Oh, Italian toothpicks (chopsticks)!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [riding past Ikea] Ikea was a wee little man!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Malia, if you want it, take it responsibly please. Mommy! Malia has my hammer! My big, heavy hammer.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: [Elliott altered the WiFi this evening and it took Brian 15 minutes to figure it out] Elliott, do you understand what happened?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I pushed buttons on the WiFi

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: No, the bigger picture.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Yes, my parents won't let me do what I want to do.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [taking his scooter down a hill] Weeee! Gravitational pull!

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [Elliott was telling us about his pretend business] Where do you work?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: K-U-M-different-C

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Can I make a sign for Mommy's race tomorrow? It will say 'Yay Mommy! You are doing a great job running at this time of day.'

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Reading a verse about the care God put in to his creation during devotions] Especially when he was making the crab. That could have hurt!

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: [brushing Elliott's teeth] There are some things we can count on in life

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Paint on the wall!

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Malia running away when its time to brush her teeth.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: That's what it's all about. Deuteronomy 3:4

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [Brian was talking about wanting to make grilled french bread pizza for Mother's day tomorrow and Madiken was saying the ingredients we had available] We have some mozzarella

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I have some corned beef

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: It wouldn't be so tricky if you were not so wiggly.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Did all of the hail from the thunderstorm this morning melt or did you eat it?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I didn't eat all the hail. I would get a stomach ache and that would hurt until dinner.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Parent! Warning. Malia! Bathroom. Toilet. Getting into.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Elliott, don't touch the table. Your hands are dirty.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [without missing a beat] Why? The table is dirty, too.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Daddy, can you do surgery on my hip? Its been sore for 3 years because of asthma.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I have a baby in my tummy. It will be 6 years old next month. Right now it is 11.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [During family clean up time] Madiken: Thanks for helping, Elliott.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: While Malia sits and looks at a book

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: [Elliot preparing for a game of chase with Brian] Where are you going to go?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Where are you going to follow?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Thank you, madam. What does madam mean?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: It's a nice way of saying older woman.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Thank you, madam's apple

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I'm going to put my Clemson football shirt on.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Chiefs?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Yes, Clemson Chiefs. So when I go outside everyone will think that I am a football player.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Eating a cookie after dinner] Come on boys! Put that sugar in my mouth.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Daddy, when are we going to get a pizza robot?

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Why do you want a pizza robot?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: To use it to make pizzas every day.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Elliott trying to hold his place in line for using the sink] Mom, I'm going to be a little top-short.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Top-short? What does that mean?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I'm going to be a little late.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Oh, you are running behind?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Yeah

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: If you eat cheese, you might get the stinks.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Daddy, we are sharing germs. We are the official germ sharing people.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [While praying] Thank you for Dad for spending money at stores so that they can stay open

content:
Elliott yelling from the bathroom after getting down from the table to wash his hands…
Elliott running out of the bathroom: Ow, a fox bit me! Can you scare the foxes and lions away? And there are hyenas too!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Counting us down for his bedtime song] 1, 2, 3 How many ornaments on the tree? I'm going to count them. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 Oh no! I lost control of my numbers.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Elliott, you've got to stop disassembling stuff

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: But I am such a curious boy.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: At least keep the parts if you disassemble stuff

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I can't help that I'm such a curious boy!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: You're such an encourager mommy. Thanks for encouraging me to to do nothing!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Yelling to Brian as he is running to the bathroom to get his step stool] Thank you, Martin!

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Brian was starting to roast coffee] I called him Martin because hes startin'

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Elliott, would you like to help me rake the leaves?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: No, I'm just here to jump in the leaf piles.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Elliott to Brian having a hard time leaving family] Put on the brakes and head back, Mr. Scholl!

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [In the front seat talking to Brian] These fall colors really are nice.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: What did you say? You saw a rollerblader?!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: What could be worse than having cereal with cows milk?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Elliott falling while running in circles around the yard] That's okay! Falling is a part of running.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Mom, how did the soap get hood?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: How did the soap get what?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: How did the soap get hide?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: How did the soap get hidden?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Yeah. [Learning English is hard sometimes]

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Mommy, can you read what the warning label says on my marble run box?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: It probably just says small pieces, choking hazard.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I think it says warning, breakable, get scratched.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Sometime can we take a subway to Alabama?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Brian talked with his mouth full of cereal] Can I try doing what you were doing?

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: What's that?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Elliott giving exaggerated examples] Talking while chewing with my mouth full

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I love you more than slow legs can slow walk

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [To Malia after a nap] You have a dry diaper!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Yay! That means she can start underwear.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [Elliott talking about how he knows how to do good] The holy spirit leads you.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: But how? The holy spirit isn't God

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [Goes through the trinity

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: And God the King of the Jews. But we don't talk about that. And God the baby.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [Takes a sip of coffee from a thermos that she is sharing with Brian]

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Mommy, are you going to drink all of daddy's coffee up?

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Thanks for looking out for me Elliott!

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Are you sleepy? Is it tough being 3 years old?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Rubbing his eyes] It's tough being helpful.

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: Which of you is more responsible?

content.speaker: Everleigh
content.text: Elliott!

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: Which of you is funnier?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Me!

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: Do you know what responsible means? It means that you make good decisions, you do…

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Hangs up on Aunt Leigh]

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Aunt Leigh, can you stop talking? I need to have a bowel movement. [Elliott's attempt at asking Aunt Leigh politely to 'hold that thought, be right back.']

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Looking at his alphabet cereal bowl. The design was a little hard to read.] Where is the letter E on here? They forgot about the E!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Mom, you can come in here. Just don't panic! What's panic mean?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: What's your favorite thing to do outside?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Play in the snow. When will it be snowing again?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: In 6 months.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: That's a long year. I don't want to wait that long

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Brian and Madiken were hugging] I want to join this piece of expression.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Elliott, you have your I love Dad shirt on. Do you love me?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Yes, I do love you even more than my Thanksgiving dinner!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Don't make any more photocopies until rest time is over and I can watch you!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Coming out of his room at rest time] FYI I'm going to go to the bathroom.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Leaving the park] Mom, can you give me some crackers? The Bible says if he is hungry give him something to eat, if he is thirsty give him something to drink.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Hey Siri! can you get me some crackers?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I said 'Hey Siri!' How do babies grow?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [Cringing]

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: She said I found some videos on the web for you, but it went to your password screen when I clicked it

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Phew!

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: It's time for me to hang up, okay?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I want to keep talking.

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: What do you want to talk about?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: How was your day? Do you have a dad?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Listening to Rachmaninoff at lunch] Why is he called rockin' on and off?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Elliott helping Brian weed outside] Daddy, I'm your business helper!

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Oh what does a business helper do?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: He helps you do weeds and helps you do deeds!

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: [Elliott was talking about Everleigh's scrapes and asked how she got them] I think she tripped and fell on the sidewalk.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Maybe she tripped on an ant… on an Aunt Leigh.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Madiken reprimanded Elliott for pulling on Malia's legs while she was breastfeeding] I'm playing Tug-a-Bug.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Does Amen remind you of the men's bathroom?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Elliott pointing to his ribs] I call these bumpys with joy.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Which way did we go?

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Roe Avenue

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: No, which poke-out end?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [Thinking like Elliott] Rosewood

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Ah [Elliott meant what street did we take to exit our neighborhood.]

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Mommy, can you get me more water in my cup? It spilled slash I knocked it over with my broom.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: [Repeating himself multiple times and Elliott not listening] Elliott, can you go wash your hands? Elliott, are you listening to me or am I taking to a wall?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Immediately turns his attention to Brian] Can you talk to a wall?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I touched a dead snake yesterday.

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: Oh! What did it feel like when you touched it?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Uh... dead.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Stalling before bed] How are your feelings going?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: They are good! Thanks for asking. We can talk more about them tomorrow.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: How are your vines?

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: What??

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Lifts up his sleeves and points to his veins.]

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: The inside of my mouth hurts.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: Why does it hurt?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I'm talking too much

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [Changing Malia's diaper] Oh, wow! That's a lot of bowel movement.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Oh, wow! You are going to have to take care of that.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [Changing Malia's diaper again] Oh, wow!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Good luck truck!

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: [Elliott was swatting his hands at dust particles in the air] What are you doing?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Getting the dust.

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: That's fairy dust!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: No, it's just dust.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I want to call Everleigh

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: I want to keep talking with you!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Whining] I want to call Everleigh

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: Then who will I talk to?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Looking devious] Uncle Reed

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Elliott, do you want any green onions?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: No, I do not think humans can digest them.

content.speaker: Malia
content.text: [Grunts while ripping Elliott's paper]

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Okay you said that! I'll forgive your sins!

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I'm going to put this popsicle stick in my bed so I have a friend at night time. I'm going to name him Napel Bapel.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: [Elliott annoyingly flapping Grandpa's ear] What are you doing?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: A magic trick

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Grandpa, I'm sorry your coat got stuck.

content.speaker: Grandpa
content.text: Its ok. I was able to get it

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: It wasn't like Aunt Leigh's coat. Do you remember that she said she needed to cut it?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Yeah, that was a ga-saster.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: My tummy super hurts.

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: Do you need to go to the bathroom?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: No it's just a part of how I was born.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: And I'm going to say GRANDPA!!! Come out of your house and build another snowman.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Reminiscing about the magic school bus discovers the human body] I love blood cells!

content.speaker: Madiken
content.text: [Laughs]

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I'm sorry that a school bus cant fit in our mouth. But it could fit in yours because yours is bigger. But when it comes out it would be super chewn. And all the kids would be like holy moly.

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: [While Elliott told Leigh about his valentine's day cookie decorating party she noted 3 inconsistencies] You are what we could call an unreliable narrator.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: No

content.speaker: Leigh
content.text: Can you say "I am an unreliable narrator?"

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: I am a dragon.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [Elliott told Brian his full name in the car this afternoon. It was the first time he said it unprompted.] "I am Elliott Thomas Helsel".

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: [Later at dinner] What is your full name?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Helsel

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: No, your full name.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Helsel. H-E-L-S-E-L.

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: That's your last name. How about your full name?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: Thomas

content.speaker: Brian
content.text: What is your first name?

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: My mother's son.

content.speaker: Elliott
content.text: [While we were having lunch. Out of the blue...] Would you be sad if you didn't have a mandarijntje on a hike?
Apparently Madiken is known for certain grab and go snacks.

content:
As Madiken gets dressed in pre-pregnancy pants…
Elliott: Those dont look like they go on very well. I have some pants that dont snap easily either.

Asking Elliott to count dots on the die (3).
Madiken: How many dots are there ?
Elliott: one, two, and one more.

Elliott: I want to change my pants.
Brian: Why?
Elliott: To wear beautiful pants like you, Daddy.
Brian: Im wearing blue jeans.
Elliott: *Takes off his blue jeans and puts on sweat pants*

Brian was trying to get Elliott to stop talking so we could have devotions
Elliott: I'll put my voice in a vase
Brian: ?!?!
Elliott: I'll put it in a vase so that i dont talk anymore!

Elliott: Do you want a taste of my cookie?
Madiken: Do you want me to have a taste of your cookie?
Elliott: Yeah, I bet you want it.

Elliott at breakfast.
Elliott: Hows your day, Daddy?
Brian: My day is good.
Elliott: What have you been doing these past few years?
Brian: ???

Everleigh and Elliott talking on FaceTime while playing PlayDoh.
Everleigh: I'm making shapes.
Elliott: Can you make red?
Everleigh: Where is Malia?
Elliott: Crying.
Elliott: Daddy, you didnt unplug that, sir dude

While Brian is assembling basketball hoop…
Elliott : Will cheezits help you Daddy? We'll see!
Elliott: I'm going to use a digital wrench to put the pine needles back on the Christmas tree.

Elliott to Brian: What if I ate you?
Brian: I wouldn't be here anymore.
Elliott: No, you would be in my tummy and then my bottom and then the toilet. And then you would go to the water treatment plant.
Brian: That would be so sad. You wouldn't see me again.
Elliott: Yes I would because I would take the trail to the water treatment plant and push you back through the pipes. And then you would be back in the toilet and I would get you.

Brian: Do you want to get out your marble run?
Elliott: I already ate my breakfast so I'm ready for yours.

Elliott's knock knock joke this morning was…
Elliott: Knock knock
Brian: Whos there?
Elliott: Auntie Beth and Uncle Reed

Elliott and I were videochatting and eventually he just got up and left without saying bye.
Grandma went to get him and said, "You can say good bye and I love you, maybe."
Elliott: I love you maybe.

Madiken: *picking up after Elliott*
Elliott: *in a loud, menacing voice* Clean that stuff up! Otherwise, Im going to do it!
Brian: Thanks Elliott. Thats only what weve been asking you to do for the past hour!

*Elliott sits down with a Christmas book*
Madiken: Elliott, do you like that book?
Elliott: Yeah, I do. Its got a lot of flaps though.
Madiken: Do you like looking at all the flaps?
Elliott: *sighs* Yes, but it makes me tired.

[Elliott stroking Madiken's abdomen]
